subject: Politics
title: Legitimacy and Consent
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Legitimacy and Consent.

hook.text: Saddam Hussein won 99.96% of the vote. Legitimacy isn't about ballots â€” it's about real belief.

buildup.text: Legitimacy means people accept the government's right to rule. Without it, states need raw force.

discovery.text: Weber named three types: traditional (kings), charismatic (leaders), and legal-rational (laws).

twist.text: Even dictators seek legitimacy. Naked force is expensive. Belief is cheaper than bullets.

climax.text: When legitimacy collapses, regimes fall. The Soviet Union lost belief before it lost power.

punchline.text: Power without belief is just force. Force always runs out.

quiz.question: What are Weber's three types of political legitimacy?
